description: Erection of a new part 5 storey/part 6 storey building with basement and rooftop plant enclosure, containing a supermarket and mixed commercial space (A1- retail/A2- financial and professional services/A3- restaurants/A4- drinking establishments/A5- takeaways/ B1 - offices/D1 non-residential institutions/D2- assembly and leisure uses) at basement and ground floors; 2,300sq m of office space; 69 flats (thirty seven x 1 bed, twenty four x 2 bed and  eight x 3 bed) (including 35% affordable housing); and raised garden at first floor level.
decision_conditions:
CONDITION:  The existing historic stone plaque in the boundary wall of Compton Passage should be salvaged and relocated within a publicly accessible area of the development to be agreed by the Local Planning Authority.  The plaque shall be relocated prior to the occupation of any of the hereby approved uses.

REASON:  To preserve the historic interest of the area.
